Houston Library

class Houston.libhouston.Channel(label, spw)[source]¶

Object representing the state of a channel

Parameters:
  • label (str) – Label of Channel to represent
  • spw – Spacewalk object
Returns:

Channel instance

The Channel object is the workhorse for any channel related calls.

Channel is a dictionary like object that is intended to provide simple fast access to the relevant details about the channel.

keys:

  • int - id

  • string - name

  • string - label

  • string - arch_name

  • string - summary

  • string - description

  • string - checksum_label

  • dateTime.iso8601 - last_modified

  • string - maintainer_name

  • string - maintainer_email

  • string - maintainer_phone

  • string - support_policy

  • string - gpg_key_url

  • string - gpg_key_id

  • string - gpg_key_fp

  • dateTime.iso8601 - yum repo_last_sync (optional)

  • string - end_of_life

  • string - parent_channel_label

  • string - clone_original

  • list - repos
    • int - id
  • dict - all_packages All packages available in the channel
    • pkgid:
      • PKG object
  • dict - latest_packages Latest versions of packages in the channel
    • pkgid:
      • PKG object
  • dict - older_packages Older versions of packages in the channel
    • int pkgid:
      • PKG object

  • bool - globally_subscribable Whether anyone can register to the channel

  • list - children channels who are children of the channel
    • Channel object
  • dict - errata all errata assigned to the channel
    • int id - Errata ID.

class Houston.libhouston.PKG(pkgid, spw)[source]¶

OO representation of an RPM.

This module intends to instantiate an object that can be used as if it was an rpm and interface with the rhn server.

class Houston.libhouston.Spacewalk(server=None, user=None, password=None, verbose=False, conf='/home/peteches/.spw_conf')[source]¶

parent Class for interacting with Spacewalk

Parameters:
  • server (str) – Spacewalk Server to login to
  • user (str) – username to login with
  • password (str) – password to use to log in with.
  • verbose (bool) – whether to use verbose xmlrpc connection.

The Spacewalk Object opens a connection to the spacewalk server, using auth method with the connection details provided. If it has access to a tty it will prompt the user if any details are missing.

Can be used as a context manager, in which case it will log out of the session during __exit__(). If instantiated manually then this will also need to be done manually. For security’s sake using spacewalk as a context manager is best.

There are several useful generic Methods for interacting with the Spacewalk server, but most of the grunt work is done by Namespaced classes.

api_call(namespace, method, *args)[source]¶

Makes RPC call to the server.

The session key will be automatically added, any other arguments must be supplied.

Parameters:
  • namespace (string) – Namespace of the method to call
  • method (string) – Method to call
  • *args – any arguments to pass to api call
Returns:

result of api call
channel_exists(channel)¶

checks to see if channel exists.

Parameters:channel (str) – channel label to check
Returns:Boolean
lucerne_query(query, channels=None, keys=None)[source]¶

runs lucerne query on the spacewalk server

Parameters:
  • query (string) – lucernce query
  • channels (list of channel labels) – channel label to run search agains (opt)
  • keys (list of activation keys) – activation key to run search against.(opt)
Returns:

  • list:

    • dict - package overview

      • int - id
      • str - name
      • str - summary
      • str - description
      • str - version
      • str - release
      • str - arch
      • str - epoch
      • str - provider

runs the `lucerne query`_ provided and returns a list of dicts with the keys above.

If any channels or activation keys are supplied then the query is run against each one in turn ( using appropriate rpc calls e.g. advanced_with_act_key or advanced_with_channel ) Then the results of each call are merged, de-duplicated and returned.

subscribe_base_channel(systemid, channel, recurse)[source]¶

Subscribes system (systemid) to base channel (channel).

This will also determine all allowed child channels the system can be subscribed to and subscribe it to them.

Parameters:
  • systemids (list) – list of spacewalk system ids
  • channel (str) – channel label of base channel to subscribe to
  • recurse (bool) – subscribe to children of <channel>
Returns:

Boolean
